sentences: Alasdair George S. Clayre (9 October 1935 â€“ 10 January 1984) was an English author, broadcaster, singer-songwriter, and academic.
Clayre was born in Southampton, Hampshire on 9 October 1935.

He graduated with a congratulatory first class degree - the highest class of degree awarded at Oxford (see British undergraduate degree classification) - and won a Prize Fellowship to All Soul's College - one of the highest academic honours in the United Kingdom.
Clayre took his own life in 1984 by jumping in front of a train in North London.
The Impact of Broadcasting; or, Mrs Buckle's Wall is Singing (Salisbury: Compton Russell, 1973), which includes a foreword by Asa Briggs
Dialogue (Newport: n.p., 1959), co-edited with P. Jay
